titleStmt.title: Greek inscription in elegiac distichs honouring the praet. prefect Petronius Probus from Athens (Achaia) by the proconsul An(a)tolius

availability.licence: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

layout.p: One epigraphic field, now lost. Inscribed on the convex surface of the columnar base. The first editor reported traces of an earlier inscription on the upper right-hand side.

origPlace.placeName: public space (East-side of the Roman Agora)

history.provenance: the inscription was found in 1869 on a private property (Gaspari) in the Plaka, North of the Tower of the Winds (Aerides, or «Horologium Kiristi» - Roman Agora, Athens)

div.ab:
1-2 Verse 1 Eἰκόνι χαλκείῃ σε Πρόβον | τὸν ὕπαρχον Ἀθήναις
3 Verse 2 Ἀντόλιος στῆσεν Ἑλλάδος ἀνθύπατος.

div.p: Edition based on IG II-III/2, pars V, nr. 13275.

app.note: ΑΝΤΟΛΙΟΣΣΕΝ on the stone; σ(τῆσ)εν Robert 1948; στῆσεν IG II-III/2, pars III/1, nr. 4226, Sironen 1994 and 1997

div.p: “The Proconsul of Hellas Anatolius set you up, Prefect Probus, at Athens in a statue made of bronze”.
“Par une statue en bronze, toi, ô Probus, préfet, à Athènes Anatolius, le proconsul de l’Hellas, t’a élevé”.
“Con una statua in bronzo, te, o Probus, prefetto, ad Atene Anatolius, proconsole dell’Ellade, Ti ha elevato”.
(German translation by K. Hallof in IG II/III² 13275)
The dedication was made when Probus was praetorian prefect for the first time.
